intro: Hakea fulgens, commonly known as the golden hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces striking yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are narrow, leathery, and often have a reddish or purple hue. Hakea fulgens is adapted to dry, well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal regions.
